results.title: Dogs in Space
results.creator_credit: Richard Lowenstein, Glenys Rowe, Burrowes Film Group and Entertainment Media
results.brief_description: Young people enjoy the summer of 1979 in the belief that they will never grow up and join the adult world. Action centres on a Melbourne household of punks, hippies, students and radicals who represent the counter culture and the punk generation.

constellations_other.name: Black Power through film and TV
constellations_other.description: The Black Power movement of the late 1960s and early 70s was “the most exciting and dynamic era in modern Indigenous history” according to Aboriginal activist Professor Gary Foley, who gained widespread attention for protests during the time and later leveraged film and TV to fight for Indigenous rights.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Lowenstein, Glenys Rowe, Burrowes Film Group and Entertainment Media
results.description: A group of young people enjoy the summer of 1979 in the belief that they will never grow up and join the adult world. Action centres on a Melbourne household of punks, hippies, students and radicals who represent the counter culture and the punk generation living on sex, drugs, rock ‘n’ roll and television. Stars Michael Hutchence of INXS.
description_for_label: A group of young people enjoy the summer of 1979 in the belief that they will never grow up and join the adult world. Action centres on a Melbourne household of punks, hippies, students and radicals who represent the counter culture and the punk generation living on sex, drugs, rock ‘n’ roll and television. Stars Michael Hutchence of INXS.

results.title: Monkey Grip
results.creator_credit: Ken Cameron, Patricia Lovell and Pavilion Films
results.brief_description: Explores the joys and traumas of a group of people living in Melbourne’s inner-city. Revolving around the life of a single mother sharing a communal house, the film portrays the lives of talented and reckless artists who refuse to live by the conventional rules.

constellations_other.name: Jan Chapman
constellations_other.description: From an independent Sydney cinema to the world's stage, Jan Chapman's work has many connections to the Australian film scene and Hollywood.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ken Cameron, Patricia Lovell and Pavilion Films
results.description:
Explores the joys and traumas of a group of people living in Melbourne’s inner-city in the early 1980s. Revolving around the life of a single mother sharing a communal house, the film portrays the lives of talented and reckless musicians, actors and writers who refuse to live by the conventional rules. Noni Hazelhurst received an AFI Best Actress Award for her performance in 1982.

Starring Noni Hazelhurst, Colin Friels, Harold Hopkins, Candy Raymond, Michael Caton, Tim Burns, Cathy Downes, Lisa Peers, Din Miller-Robinson, Alice Garner and Christina Amphlett from the ‘Divinyls’. Adapted from Helen Garner’s novel ‘Monkey Grip’ by Ken Cameron in association with Helen Garner. Cinematography by David Gribble. Editing by David Huggett.
description_for_label:
Explores the joys and traumas of a group of people living in Melbourne’s inner-city in the early 1980s. Revolving around the life of a single mother sharing a communal house, the film portrays the lives of talented and reckless musicians, actors and writers who refuse to live by the conventional rules. Noni Hazelhurst received an AFI Best Actress Award for her performance in 1982.

Starring Noni Hazelhurst, Colin Friels, Harold Hopkins, Candy Raymond, Michael Caton, Tim Burns, Cathy Downes, Lisa Peers, Din Miller-Robinson, Alice Garner and Christina Amphlett from the ‘Divinyls’. Adapted from Helen Garner’s novel ‘Monkey Grip’ by Ken Cameron in association with Helen Garner. Cinematography by David Gribble. Editing by David Huggett.

results.title: Head On
results.creator_credit: Ana Kokkinos, Jane Scott and Head On Productions
results.brief_description: Ana Kokkinos’s debut follows the angry, confused and nihilistic 19-year-old Greek Australian, Ari (Alex Dimitriades) through 24 hours fuelled by drugs, booze and anonymous sex as he grapples with his sexuality and clashes with his traditional Greek family.

constellations_other.name: Ana Kokkinos
constellations_other.description: The films and TV works of Ana Kokkinos often explore the experiences of second-generation Australians, queer identities and class. Since beginning her career in the early 90s, those stories have started to appear more frequently on Australian screens.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ana Kokkinos, Jane Scott and Head On Productions
results.description:
Based on the novel Loaded by Christos Tsiolkas, Ana Kokkinos’s compelling debut feature Head On is a volatile, confronting and at times bleak look at race, sexuality and class in contemporary Australian society. The film’s lead protagonist Ari (Alex Dimitriades) is an angry, confused, nihilistic, unemployed 19-year-old Greek Australian. The film traces a particularly explosive 24 hours in his life, fuelled by drugs, booze and anonymous sex as he grapples with his sexuality and clashes with his traditional Greek family, who he views with equal amounts of respect and contempt. Performances are excellent throughout, in particular Paul Capsis as Ari’s defiant crossdressing friend Johnny/Toula.

Cast includes Elena Mandalis, Eugenia Fragos, Julian Garner, Dora Kaskanis, Alex Papps, Damien Fotiou. Awards: Best Actor (Alex Dimitriades) and Best Supporting Actor (Paul Capsis) for the 1999 Film Critics Circle of Australia Awards.

Best Feature Film Adaptation (Andrew Bovell, Ana Kokkinos, Mira Robertson) 1998 Awgie Awards.

Best Director (Ana Kokkinos) 1999 San Francisco Lesbian and Gay Film Festival.

Best Achievement in Editing (Jill Bilcock) 1998 AFI Awards.
description_for_label:
Based on the novel Loaded by Christos Tsiolkas, Ana Kokkinos’s compelling debut feature Head On is a volatile, confronting and at times bleak look at race, sexuality and class in contemporary Australian society. The film’s lead protagonist Ari (Alex Dimitriades) is an angry, confused, nihilistic, unemployed 19-year-old Greek Australian. The film traces a particularly explosive 24 hours in his life, fuelled by drugs, booze and anonymous sex as he grapples with his sexuality and clashes with his traditional Greek family, who he views with equal amounts of respect and contempt. Performances are excellent throughout, in particular Paul Capsis as Ari’s defiant crossdressing friend Johnny/Toula.

Cast includes Elena Mandalis, Eugenia Fragos, Julian Garner, Dora Kaskanis, Alex Papps, Damien Fotiou. Awards: Best Actor (Alex Dimitriades) and Best Supporting Actor (Paul Capsis) for the 1999 Film Critics Circle of Australia Awards.

Best Achievement in Editing (Jill Bilcock) 1998 AFI Awards.

results.title: The Homesteader
results.brief_description: Directed by Oscar Micheaux and Jerry Mills.

constellations_other.name: Jedda: Uneven ground, the road to on-screen diversity
constellations_other.description: Jedda was the first fully funded Australian feature to be shot on colour film. It was also the first Australian film with Aboriginal actors in lead roles, however, it reflects a deeply problematic time in Australian history.

results.description: Directed by Oscar Micheaux and Jerry Mills.
description_for_label: Directed by Oscar Micheaux and Jerry Mills.

results.title: Dracula
results.brief_description: A seductive and elegant screen adaptation of the stage version of Bram Stoker’s immortal classic Dracula, penned by Hamilton Dean and John L. Balderston.
results.description: A seductive and elegant screen adaptation of the stage version of Bram Stoker’s immortal classic Dracula, penned by Hamilton Dean and John L. Balderston. On a storm-lashed sea, a ship bearing mysterious cargo is thrown into disorder by both the fierce conditions and the bizarre deaths of most of the crew. High above the cliffs of the English coast, another form of chaos ensues as the inmates of Dr. Seward’s asylum react badly to the storm, while his daughter Lucy’s companion, Mina Van Helsing, is lured from her sick-bed to rescue the only survivor of the shipwreck. The charming but enigmatic Count Dracula quickly ingratiates himself into Seward’s home, and spellbinds Mina, who is soon found dead under bizarre circumstances. Overwhelmed by guilt, Seward contacts Mina’s father, Professor Van Helsing, who promptly appears to investigate the cause of his daughter’s death, only to discover the true identity of their beguiling guest. However, the Count has already set his sights on Lucy, and Van Helsing and Lucy’s bewildered fiance Jonathon Harker must confront the demon interloper if they are to save her from a fate worse than death. Frank Langella stars as Dracula (a role reprised from the stage adaptation), with Sir Laurence Olivier as Van Helsing, Donald Pleasence as Dr. Seward, and Kate Nelligan as Lucy. Features an atmospheric soundtrack by composer John Williams, performed by the London Symphony Orchestra.
description_for_label: A seductive and elegant screen adaptation of the stage version of Bram Stoker’s immortal classic Dracula, penned by Hamilton Dean and John L. Balderston. However, the Count has already set his sights on Lucy, and Van Helsing and Lucy’s bewildered fiance Jonathon Harker must confront the demon interloper if they are to save her from a fate worse than death. Frank Langella stars as Dracula (a role reprised from the stage adaptation), with Sir Laurence Olivier as Van Helsing, Donald Pleasence as Dr. Seward, and Kate Nelligan as Lucy. Features an atmospheric soundtrack by composer John Williams, performed by the London Symphony Orchestra.

results.title: Double indemnity
results.brief_description: Double Indemnity is possibly the definitive film noir. It features a sharp, literate screenplay with great dialogue, a stylish, cool and erotic mise-en-scene by director Billy Wilder, and a stunning performance by Barbara Stanwyck.
results.description: Double Indemnity is possibly the definitive film noir. It features a sharp, literate screenplay with great dialogue (Raymond Chandler worked on the script), a stylish, cool and erotic mise-en-scene by director Billy Wilder, and a stunning performance by Barbara Stanwyck who, in this film, is queen of the femme fatales. She plays a bewitching ice-princess who seduces a crooked insurance agent (Fred MacMurray) into helping her kill her husband to cash in on his insurance policy. This malevolant, spell-binding thriller is based on James M. Cain’s classic pulp novel. Cast also includes Edward G. Robinson.
description_for_label: Double Indemnity is possibly the definitive film noir. It features a sharp, literate screenplay with great dialogue (Raymond Chandler worked on the script), a stylish, cool and erotic mise-en-scene by director Billy Wilder, and a stunning performance by Barbara Stanwyck who, in this film, is queen of the femme fatales. She plays a bewitching ice-princess who seduces a crooked insurance agent (Fred MacMurray) into helping her kill her husband to cash in on his insurance policy. This malevolant, spell-binding thriller is based on James M. Cain’s classic pulp novel. Cast also includes Edward G. Robinson.

results.title: Rebecca
results.brief_description: The story follows a newly married young woman who, upon arriving at her husband’s imposing family estate on a bleak English coast, finds herself battling the shadow of his deceased first wife, the mysterious Rebecca, whose legacy continues to haunt the house.

constellations_other.name: The Hatfield House rules
constellations_other.description: The shooting location of The Favourite, Hatfield House, has appeared in a number of other iconic works.

results.description: The story follows a newly married young woman who, upon arriving at her husband’s imposing family estate on a bleak English coast, finds herself battling the shadow of his deceased first wife, the mysterious Rebecca, whose legacy continues to haunt the house.

results.title: Full Frontal
results.brief_description: Full Frontal was an Australian sketch comedy series which debuted in 1993. The show first aired on the Seven Network on 13 May 1993, and finished on 18 September 1997.

constellations_other.name: Eric Bana
constellations_other.description: There must be something that draws Australian creatives like Eric Bana to darker material as they shoot to stardom overseas. Australia's penal colony past perhaps?

constellations_other.name: Nightly news and laughs
constellations_other.description: Throughout the decades on Australian screens, comedy and news have often gone hand-in-hand.

constellations_other.name: Australian TV in the 1990s
constellations_other.description: In the 1990s, Australians and Australian culture was changing: so too were the representations of it on television.

results.description:
Full Frontal was an Australian sketch comedy series which debuted in 1993. The show first aired on the Seven Network on 13 May 1993, and finished on 18 September 1997.

In 1998 a spin-off of the show moved to Network Ten under the name Totally Full Frontal, losing most of the original cast in the process and finished in 1999.

Since 2008, re-runs have begun screening on The Comedy Channel as part of the channel’s “Aussie Gold” block of locally made, classic comedy programming.
description_for_label:
Full Frontal was an Australian sketch comedy series which debuted in 1993. The show first aired on the Seven Network on 13 May 1993, and finished on 18 September 1997.

In 1998 a spin-off of the show moved to Network Ten under the name Totally Full Frontal, losing most of the original cast in the process and finished in 1999.

Since 2008, re-runs have begun screening on The Comedy Channel as part of the channel’s “Aussie Gold” block of locally made, classic comedy programming.

images.alt_text: The poster for Full Frontal featuring cast members in the middle of skits on a white background

results.title: Packed to the Rafters
results.brief_description: Packed to the Rafters is an Australian family-oriented television series which premiered on the Seven Network on Tuesday 26 August 2008 at 8:30 pm.

constellations_other.name: 2000s TV
constellations_other.description: The dawn of the new millennium brought a wave of Australian programming that was more ambitious and bolder than previous decades.

results.description:
Packed to the Rafters is an Australian family-oriented television series which premiered on the Seven Network on Tuesday 26 August 2008 at 8:30 pm. The show has continued on Tuesdays in this timeslot for its entire run. The drama series features a mix of lighthearted comedy woven through the plot. It revolves around the Rafter family facing work pressures and life issues, whilst also tackling serious social issues. The Logie award winning series was the highest rating to screen on the Seven Network in 2008, and the show has consistently been among the top 5 shows of the year throughout its run in Australia.

It was announced in TV Week that the sixth season of Packed to the Rafters would be the last, with Hugh Sheridan stating: “It’s emotional letting go of Rafters – for all of us. It was such an amazing chapter in Aussie TV. I’m really proud we all came back together to send it off.” The two-hour series finale of Rafters aired on 2 July 2013, which saw the return of Hugh Sheridan, Jessica Marais, Ryan Corr, Jessica McNamee and James Stewart. Rebecca Gibney said, “The cast, writers and producers have always said that we wanted to keep Rafters as one of the most-watched shows on TV. If we ever felt like we were losing too many cast members, we needed to end it on a high. We can say season six winds up an aspect of the Rafter family and there is a sense of finality to it.”
description_for_label:
